now

Source: R/Now.R
now.Rd

now

now(tzone = "")

Arguments

tzone

(character) a valid time zone, defaults to your local timezone

Examples

x <- now()
x

#> <Now>
#>   Public:
#>     clone: function (deep = FALSE) 
#>     date: active binding
#>     day: active binding
#>     hour: active binding
#>     initialize: function (tzone = "") 
#>     min: active binding
#>     month: active binding
#>     now: function () 
#>     sec: active binding
#>     time: active binding
#>     tzone: 
#>     unix_epoch: active binding
#>     utc: active binding
#>     utc_offset: active binding
#>     year: active binding
x$time

#> [1] "2021-07-12 21:06:50 UTC"
x$date

#> [1] "2021-07-12"
x$utc

#> [1] "2021-07-12 21:06:50 UTC"
x$unix_epoch

#> [1] 1626124010
x$min

#> [1] "06"
x$sec

#> [1] "50"

# mocking
Sys.Date()

#> [1] "2021-07-12"
clock_mock()
library(timefuzz)
mock <- time_fuzz$new()
## set to today + 10 days
mock$freeze(Sys.Date() + 10)
z <- now()
z

#> <Time>
#>   Inherits from: <Now>
#>   Public:
#>     clone: function (deep = FALSE) 
#>     date: active binding
#>     day: active binding
#>     hour: active binding
#>     initialize: function (tzone = "") 
#>     min: active binding
#>     mock_time: function () 
#>     month: active binding
#>     new: NULL
#>     new_with_mock_time: function (...) 
#>     new_without_mock_time: NULL
#>     now: function () 
#>     now_with_mock_time: function () 
#>     now_without_mock_time: function () 
#>     sec: active binding
#>     time: active binding
#>     tzone: 
#>     unix_epoch: active binding
#>     utc: active binding
#>     utc_offset: active binding
#>     year: active binding
z$time

#> [1] "2021-07-22 UTC"
z$date

#> [1] "2021-07-22"
z$utc

#> [1] "2021-07-22 UTC"
z$unix_epoch

#> [1] 1626912000
z$min

#> [1] "00"
z$sec

#> [1] "00"
